gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ੳੁਲੂ ਦਿਨ ਸਮੈ ਕਾਹੂਅੈ ਨ ਦੇਖਿਓ ਭਾਵੈ ਤੈਸੇ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮੈ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Uloo Din Samai Kaahooai N Daykhiao Bhaavai , Taisay Saadhasangati Mai Aan Dayv Sayvakai ?
translation: Just as sight of an owl during the day is not appreciated by any body, so is a follower of a god not liked by the disciple of the True Guru in their holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕੳੂਅਾ ਬਿਦਿਅਾਮਾਨ ਬੋਲਤ ਨ ਕਾਹੂ ਭਾਵੈ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕ ਜੳੁ ਬੋਲੈ ਅਹੰਮੇਵ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Kaooaa Bidiaamaan Bolat N Kaahoo Bhaavai , Aan Dayv Sayvak Jau Bolai Ahanmayv Kai ?
translation: Just as a crow cawing is not appreciated by anyone, just as a devotee of a god is not appreciated in the holy assembly of god-like True Guru. (because he may be saying haughty traits of his deity)

gurmukhi: ਕਟਤ ਚਟਤ ਸ੍ਵਾਨ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਬਿਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਜੈਸੇ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕ ਸੁਹਾੲਿ ਨ ਕਟੇਵ ਕੈ
transliteration: Katat Chatat Svaan Preeti Bipreeti Jaisay , Aan Dayv Sayvak Suhaai N Katayv Kai ?
translation: Just as a dog licks when he is patted and bites when shouted and scolded at. (both acts are not good),

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਰਾਲ ਮਾਲ ਸੋਭਤ ਨ ਬਗੁ ਠਗੁ ਕਾਢੀਅੈ ਪਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕੈ ||੪੫੨||
transliteration: Jaisay Maraal Maal Sobhat N Bagu Tthagu , Kaaddheeai Pakari Kari Aan Dayv Sayvakai ?452?
translation: Just as a heron does not fit in the group of swans and is turned out from there, so does a devotee of some god or goddess not fit into the holy assembly of God-worshipping saints. Such fake devotees should be turned out from these assemblies.  (452)
